chapter.tagline: Explaining the believer’s freedom from the Mosaic law and life in the higher law of the Spirit.

questions.q: Is the believer still under the Ten Commandments?
questions.a: No. The believer is under the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus, not the Mosaic code. The moral intent is fulfilled in love through the Spirit, not rule-keeping.

questions.q: Did Jesus come to abolish the law?
questions.a: He came to fulfill it, not abolish it. By fulfilling it, He rendered it complete so believers now live by His finished work, not the old system.

questions.q: What is the difference between law and grace?
questions.a: Law demands; grace supplies. Law says 'do and live'; grace says 'live and therefore do.' Grace empowers what law only commands.

questions.q: Does grace give license to sin?
questions.a: Never. Grace empowers righteousness. True understanding of grace produces holiness, not compromise.

questions.q: Why couldn’t the law make man righteous?
questions.a: Because it addressed actions, not nature. Only Christ’s life within could change the heart and produce true righteousness.

questions.q: What replaced the old law for believers?
questions.a: The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus—an inward principle where the Spirit guides and empowers obedience from within.

questions.q: What does Paul mean by 'we are not under law but under grace'?
questions.a: He means believers no longer relate to God through legal demands but through favor and life in the Spirit. Grace is the new governing system.

questions.q: Why was the law called a schoolmaster?
questions.a: Because it tutored man until Christ came. Once faith arrived, the believer graduated from external regulations to internal guidance.

questions.q: How should believers view the Old Testament law today?
questions.a: As shadow and instruction pointing to Christ. It reveals principles but not requirements for the new-creation life.

questions.q: What proves a believer lives above the law?
questions.a: When love rules his heart. Love is the fulfillment of the law, and the Spirit sheds that love abroad within every born-again believer.
